prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: Considering the line width obtained from our past survey (~7 km/s), our velocity resolution (~0.7 km/s) will enable us to resolve the line shape of this source.

Cesaroni et al.(2010) reported there are three continuum conponent in 2" x 2" region. In order to compare the CH2NH distribution with the past study, we set angular resolution to be 1.0 arcsec. The largest angular scale is set to be 10", considering the case that CH2NH source is extended than these structure.

The strength of three CH2NH transition was calculated based on CH2NH abundance from our past surveys. In G10.47+0.03, our CH2NH column density is 4.7 x 10^15 cm-2. Line parameters were obtained from splatalogue. Since excitation temperature is not well determined, we assumed both lower (20 K) and higher values (100 K). As the results, we found that the weakest transition should be observed at least 890 mK. Thus, we set requested RMS to be 170 mK to achieve 5-sigma detections. Considering the line width obtained from our past survey (~7 km/s), our velocity resolution (~0.7 km/s) will enable us to resolve the line shapes of this source. For continuum flux, sufficient S/N ratio will be achieved from line-free channels. We will also observe nearby well studied HII regions and young stellar objects to increase the sample of CH2NH sources.
Considering the line width obtained from our past survey (~7 km/s), our velocity resolution (~0.7 km/s) will enable us fully resolve the line shape of this source.

Cesaroni et al.(2010) reported there are three continuum conponent in 2" x 2" region. In order to compare the CH2NH distribution with the past study, we set angular resolution to be 1.0 arcsec. The largest angular scale is set to be 10", considering the case that CH2NH source is extended than these structure.

In G10.47+0.03, our CH2NH column density is 4.7 x 10^15 cm-2. Line parameters were obtained from splatalogue. Since excitation temperature is not well determined, we assumed both lower (20 K) and higher values (100 K). In both cases, we found that the weakest line would be observed at least 1460 mK. We assumed the strength of recombination line to be 100mK so that weaker components are detected. Thus, we set requested RMS to be 33 mK to achieve 3-sigma detections of both lines. Considering the line width obtained from our past survey (~7 km/s), our velocity resolution (~0.7 km/s) will enable us fully resolve the line shape of this source. For continuum flux, sufficient S/N ratio will be achieved from line-free channels.
Considering the line width obtained from our past survey (~7 km/s), our velocity resolution (~0.7 km/s) will enable us fully resolve the line shape of this source.

Cesaroni et al.(1998) reported that continuum peak emission and NH3 peak positions are separated from each other by 5". In order to compare the CH2NH distribution with other components, we set angular resolution to be 2.0 arcsec. The largest angular scale is set to be 10", considering the case that CH2NH source is extended than these structure.

The strength of three CH2NH transition was calculated based on CH2NH abundance from our past surveys. In G31.41+0.3, our CH2NH column density is 0.8 x 10^15 cm-2. Line parameters were obtained from splatalogue. Since excitation temperature is not well determined, we assumed both lower (20 K) and higher values (100 K). As the results, we found that the weakest transition should be observed at least 160 mK. Thus, we set requested RMS to be 32 mK to achieve 5-sigma detection. Considering the line width obtained from our past survey (~7 km/s), our velocity resolution (~0.7 km/s) will enable us fully resolve the line shape of this source.For continuum flux, sufficient S/N ratio will be achieved from line-free channels.
Considering the line width obtained from our past survey (~7 km/s), our velocity resolution (~0.7 km/s) will enable us fully resolve the line shape of this source.

Cesaroni et al.(1998) reported that continuum peak emission and NH3 peak positions are separated from each other by 5". In order to compare the CH2NH distribution with other components, we set angular resolution to be 2.0 arcsec. The largest angular scale is set to be 10", considering the case that CH2NH source is extended than these structure.

In G31.43+0.3, our CH2NH column density is 0.8 x 10^15 cm-2. Line parameters were obtained from splatalogue. Since excitation temperature is not well determined, we assumed both lower (20 K) and higher values (100 K). In both cases, we found that the weakest line would be observed at least 1690 mK. We assumed the strength of recombination line to be 100 mK so that weaker components are detected. Thus, we set requested RMS to be 33 mK to achieve 3-sigma detections of both lines. Considering the line width obtained from our past survey (~7 km/s), our velocity resolution (~0.7 km/s) will enable us fully resolve the line shape of this source. For continuum flux, sufficient S/N ratio will be achieved from line-free channels. We will also observe nearby well studied HII regions and young stellar objects to increase the sample of CH2NH sources.
Considering the line width obtained from our past survey (~7 km/s), our velocity resolution (~0.7 km/s) will enable us fully resolve the line shape of this source.

Zhang et al.(1998) reported that W51 e1 and e2 are separated from each other by 5" and they reveal different physical/chemical properties. In order to compare the CH2NH distribution with the past study, we set angular resolution to be 2.0 arcsec. The largest angular scale is set to be 10", considering the case that CH2NH source is extended than these structure.

The strength of three CH2NH transition was calculated based on CH2NH abundance from our past surveys. In W51 e1/e2, our CH2NH column density is 0.3 x 10^15 cm-2. Line parameters were obtained from splatalogue. Since excitation temperature is not well determined, we assumed both lower (20 K) and higher values (100 K). As the results, we found that the weakest transition should be observed at least 60 mK. Thus, we set requested RMS to be 20 mK to achieve 3-sigma detection. Considering the line width obtained from our past survey (~7 km/s), our velocity resolution (~0.7 km/s) will enable us fully resolve the line shape of this source. For continuum flux, sufficient S/N ratio will be achieved from line-free channels.
Considering the line width obtained from our past survey (~7 km/s), our velocity resolution (~0.7 km/s) will enable us fully resolve the line shape of this source.

Zhang et al.(1998) reported that W51 e1 and e2 are separated from each other by 5" and they reveal different physical/chemical properties. In order to compare the CH2NH distribution with the past study, we set angular resolution to be 2.0 arcsec. The largest angular scale is set to be 10", considering the case that CH2NH source is extended than these structure.

In W51 e1/e2, our CH2NH column density is 0.3 x 10^15 cm-2. Line parameters were obtained from splatalogue. Since excitation temperature is not well determined, we assumed both lower (20 K) and higher values (100 K). In both cases, we found that the weakest line would be observed at least 660 mK. We assumed the strength of recombination line to be 100mK so that weaker components are detected. Thus, we set requested RMS to be 33 mK to achieve 3-sigma detections of both lines. Considering the line width obtained from our past survey (~7 km/s), our velocity resolution (~0.7 km/s) will enable us fully resolve the line shape of this source. For continuum flux, sufficient S/N ratio will be achieved from line-free channels. We will also observe nearby well studied HII regions and young stellar objects to increase the sample of CH2NH sources.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract:
We propose mapping observations of glycine precursor candidate, CH2NH and recombination line H38 towards our CH2NH sources.
Our CH2NH surveys showed that the abundances CH2NH are different from source to source. Since CH2NH is a glycine precursor candidate, the physical properties of CH2NH-rich sources will provide us with a compass to plan future amino acids surveys and to reveal their chemical evolution. Our correltion between the fractional abundances of CH2NH and hydrogen recombination line H54 would suggest that CH2NH abundance is high in early stage of phase of star formation, when HII regions are not developped.
We selected three CH2NH sources to futher investigate CH2NH-rich source properties. We will be able to determine more accurate abundances of CH2NH, with CH2NH source sizes and wide range of energy levels. To test our scenario, we will compare our high resolution CH2NH distributions with H38 distributions and detailed source structures by past studies.14 neaby sources will be also observed to increase CH2NH source samples.

prp:PrincipalInvestigator.prp:organisation: Astronomy Data Center, National Astronomical Observatory of Japan
